The random thoughts of a software developer

Archive

A/B Testing Service Implementations

So you have a service-oriented architecture of lightweight, tested components; your architecture is complete and there's no reason to worry, right? How did you build the services? Did you try different approaches or just the first one that came to mind? Is that the best implementation? Is it the most scalable? Is it the most understandable? What happens when those who wrote it have gone? - Posted on 23 April 2015.

Isolating yourself from change

At last month's Cambridge Software Craftsmanship round table meeting we had a very interesting discussion on how we should isolate ourselves from change, we went from choosing the right technology to seeing this more as an architectural problem that allows you to embrace change. - Posted on 03 January 2013.

Make Use of Your Subconscious Mind

How many of us find a solution to a complex problem when we are away from our desks? In the shower? With friends? What powers this sudden insight? - Posted on 17 May 2012.

Creating Your Oasis Of Calm

To become more Open we need to get ourselves into a place and time where we are relaxed, in this post I talk a bit about how we do that - Posted on 15 May 2012.

Creative Play

Creativity is at the heat of what we do and often we are the most creative when we are at play as we unleash the power of our imagination. I argue that we should bring play into the business. - Posted on 28 April 2012.

Creativity

Creativity, isn't that at the core of what we do? - Posted on 25 April 2012.
